intro: Ardisia applanata, commonly known as the flat-leaf evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myricaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in short inflorescences. Following flowering, it develops bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia applanata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal floral display.
